medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 14 days before admission with malaise and a nonpainful, nonpruritic, erythematous, maculopapular rash that first appeared on the thighs and then became diffuse. Over the next 10 days, malaise persisted, the rash did not improve, and mild dry cough developed. Mild blurred vision occurred, worse in the left eye, with mild photophobia and floaters. Arthralgias of the knees developed two days before admission, leading to her evaluation in the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, anxiety, depression, cataracts, osteopenia, tonsillectomy during childhood, myomectomy and ovarian cystectomy 32 years prior, allograft reconstruction of an injured right anterior cruciate ligament 11 years prior, and no known allergies to medications.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of diabetes mellitus, hypertension, coronary artery disease, and stroke.
medical_history.social_history: Married, lives with husband in a suburban area of New England, retired, had traveled extensively including a trip to a national park in central India where she received multiple mosquito bites, observed wild animals without contact, does not drink alcohol or use illicit drugs, and stopped smoking tobacco 34 years ago with a history of 14 pack-years.
